casepack.title: Complete Astronomy Domain — Stellar, Orbital & Galactic Physics
casepack.description: Comprehensive astronomy casepack covering 6 subdomains: stellar luminosity (Stefan-Boltzmann, mass-luminosity), spectral analysis (Wien, Planck, B-V calibration), distance ladder (parallax, distance modulus, Hubble flow), orbital mechanics (Kepler's third law), gravitational dynamics (virial theorem, rotation curves, dark matter), and stellar evolution (main-sequence lifetime, HR diagram classification). 28 objects spanning spectral types O through M, white dwarfs, giants, supergiants, planetary orbits, and galaxy-scale dynamics.

run_intent.notes: Demonstrates UMCP invariant mapping for observational astronomy. Maps luminosity deviation (delta_L) to omega (drift), eccentricity to orbital fidelity, dark matter fraction to hidden state. Exercises all 4 astronomy axioms: AX-A0 (inverse square law), AX-A1 (mass determines fate), AX-A2 (spectral class encodes temperature), AX-A3 (Kepler governs orbits).

domain_coverage.spectral_analysis: Wien displacement, B-V calibration, spectral embedding
domain_coverage.gravitational_dynamics: Virial theorem, rotation curves, dark matter

axiom_demonstration.AX_A0: Distance modulus μ = m - M verified for all stellar targets
axiom_demonstration.AX_A1: Mass-luminosity relation tested across HR diagram
axiom_demonstration.AX_A2: Spectral class O-M embedded to [0,1], cross-checked with B-V
axiom_demonstration.AX_A3: Kepler's third law validated for Earth, Jupiter, Mars, Mercury, Halley
